intro: Gibbaeum comptonii, commonly known as the Cape foveolata, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and hardiness, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
